business.headline: RIL Q2 profit slips 5% to Rs 16,563 crore, still beats market expectationsRIL Q2 results: Reliance Industries beat street expectations in Q2 despite a 5% drop in profit, driven by strong digital and upstream growth.

HCLTech Q2 results: Net profit jumps 11% to Rs 4,235 crore, dividend declaredHCLTech declared another interim dividend of Rs 12 per share, taking the total interim dividend for the fiscal year so far to Rs 42 per share.

Retail inflation jumps to 9-month high of 5.49% in SeptemberFood prices saw an even more significant spike, with the Consumer Food Price Index (CFPI) recording a year-on-year inflation rate of 9.24%. Rural areas faced food inflation of 9.08%, while urban areas experienced an increase of 9.56%.

Hyundai Motor IPO opens tomorrow: Check latest GMP, brokerage reviews and moreHyundai Motor India IPO: Priced between Rs 1,865 and Rs 1,960 per share, the IPO is expected to raise Rs 27,856 crore through an offer for sale of 14.2 crore shares, representing a 17.5% stake.

Sensex ends 600 points higher, Nifty gains; Wipro, HDFC Bank stocks rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 591.69 points to 81,973.05 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 163.70 points to settle at 25, 127.95.

Daron Acemoglu, Simon Johnson, James A. Robinson awarded Nobel Economics Prize 2024Nobel Economics Prize 2024: This year's laureates provide valuable insights into how institutions are formed and their crucial role in fostering sustainable development and prosperity.

DA hike before Diwali? Big update for central government employeesDearness Allowance (DA) is revised twice a year, providing employees with financial support that helps maintain their purchasing power as living costs rise.

Gold, silver price today, October 14, 2024: Precious metals witness dip on MCXGold Price Today October 14, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the lower side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Monday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

HDFC Bank shares rise 2% ahead of Q2 results. What should investors do? HDFC Bank share price: Investors are showing increased interest in HDFC Bank shares, anticipating a positive performance in the upcoming quarterly results.
Explained: Why DMart shares plunged 9% in early trade todayThe sharp decline in shares came after DMart's second-quarter earnings failed to meet the market's expectations.
Sensex jumps 500 points, Nifty above 25,000; Wipro, HDFC Bank gain The S&P BSE Sensex was up 409.75 points to 81,791.11 at 10:20 am, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 126.45 points to trade at 25,090.70.

Succession Wars: The Hinduja family's bitter battle for controlAt the heart of the Hinduja family's success was their ethos of shared ownership, but this same principle ultimately sparked their multi-billion dollar feud, endangering an empire built on unity.

Boeing to cut 17,000 jobs as losses deepen amid factory strikeThe planemaker will also delay the delivery of its first 777X jet by a year. Boeing CEO Kelly Ortberg said that the comapny must shrink its workforce "to align with financial reality".

Fortunes soar: India's richest cross $1 trillion mark amid market rallyForbes' analysis shows that India's 100 richest individuals now have a total net worth of $1.1 trillion, more than doubling their wealth since 2019.

From Trent to Titan: Noel Tata's journey to the top of Tata TrustNoel Tata, born to Naval Tata and Simone Tata, has been a key figure in the Tata Group for many years. He holds several senior positions within the conglomerate.

Nariman Point's revival: Office rents expected to nearly double by 2030The report, titled 'South Mumbai – A Renaissance', attributes this expected surge to ongoing infrastructure improvements and rising demand for premium office space in the area.

Noel Tata on being named Tata Trusts Chairman: Will carry on legacy of Ratan TataNoel Tata was named Tata Trusts Chairman after a board meeting held in Mumbai on October 11, where the decision was unanimously agreed upon by the trustees.
Financial crisis looms in Delhi as extra spending tips city into revenue deficitSeveral departments have underscored additional resource needs, which strain the budget further.

Sensex, Nifty end lower as foreign investment fizzles; Tata Group shares gainThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 230.05 points to close at 81,381.36, while the Nifty50 declined by 34.20 points to end at 24,964.25.
Tata group stocks surge 3% as Noel Tata takes charge at Tata TrustsNoel Tata's appointment came after the death of Ratan Tata, former chairman of Tata Sons, on October 9 at the age of 86.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: India expels 6 Canadian diplomats, recalls its envoy as row escalatesThe government's move came hours after Canada's charge against the Indian High Commissioner and other diplomats as 'persons of interest' in the investigation into Khalistani terrorist Hardeep Singh Nijjar's murder.

Atmosphere of extremism and violence: India on downgrading ties with CanadaDuring the meeting, it was pointed out that the "current atmosphere of extremism and violence" poses a serious threat to the safety of Indian diplomats in Canada.

US withdraws note on 'Indian panel's visit' linked to Pannun murder plot probeAn Indian inquiry committee is set to visit Washington, DC, on October 15 to discuss investigations into allegations of an Indian official's involvement in Khalistani terrorist Gurpatwant Singh Pannun's murder.

What is Lawrence Bishnoi's suraksha kavach?After Delhi and Punjab, the Lawrence Bishnoi gang is making its presence felt in Mumbai. The Bombay underworld was run from abroad after the Bombay blasts of 1993. However, Lawrence Bishnoi has been running his gang from jail with impunity for the last decade. That brings up the question -- what is his suraksha kavach (shield)?

Ground report: SCO Summit to begin tomorrow in Pakistan, here's what to expectExternal Affairs Minister S Jaishankar and 7 Prime Ministers will attend the two-day SCO Council meeting starting tomorrow in Islamabad.

Thief pulls gold chain from woman's neck inside Bengaluru templeA thief snatched the gold chain of a woman at a temple in Bengaluru. He fled the scene with half of the chain, approximately 30 grams of gold, police sources said.

Bigg Boss Kannada makers in legal trouble over privacy issue of female contestantsA complaint has been filed over privacy concerns of female contestants in Bigg Boss Kannada Season 11. An enquiry has been initiated in the case by the police.
Europa Clipper begins epic journey to find what's hiding on Jupiter's moonAfter traveling nearly 2.9 billion kilometers, the spacecraft will begin a series of 49 close flybys of Europa in 2030.

Video: Crowd chases district official after outrage over murders in ChhattisgarhA video of a huge crowd chasing a Sub-Divisional Magistrate (SDM) in Chhattisgarh's Sujrapur has surfaced on social media. The locals attacked SDM Jagannath Verma when he reached the spot to calm the situation and tried to control the crowd, who had set the house of a local criminal on fire on Monday.

Rajasthan: The Royal Canvas for Dream WeddingsWhether it's the grandeur of a palace wedding in Udaipur, the mystique of a desert wedding in Jaisalmer, or the creativity of a themed wedding in Jaipur, Rajasthan offers a wedding experience that is truly out of the ordinary.

IIT Delhi's Technology & AI Leadership Programme: Shaping the Future of Tech LeadershipAdvance your career with IIT Delhi's Technology & AI Leadership Programme. Designed for aspiring tech leaders, this programme offers cutting-edge insights, practical experience, and strategic acumen to navigate the digital era. Gain the skills to drive innovation, lead digital transformations, and position yourself as a visionary in technology leadership.

India crash out in group stage, fail to reach semis after 8 yearsICC Women's T20 World Cup: Team India suffered a heart-breaking group-stage exit from the ongoing ICC tournament after New Zealand defeated Pakistan to storm into the semi-final.

Is Babar Azam too big to be dropped? Decoding Pakistan cricket's latest bombshellIn one of Pakistan cricket's boldest moves, Babar Azam was left out of the squad for the last two Tests against England at home. The decision has left the cricket world divided. Were the selectors right in 'resting' Babar? Has it dented his aura?

Man beaten to death for overtaking auto rickshaw in Mumbai, 9 arrestedThe victim, Akash, was reportedly out purchasing a new car on Dussehra when an auto-rickshaw overtook his vehicle near the Malad railway station.

China deploys record 125 warplanes in drill as 'resolute punishment' for TaiwanTo punish Taiwan's president for rejecting Beijing's claim of sovereignty, China employed a record 125 aircraft, as well as its Liaoning aircraft carrier and ships, in large-scale military exercises surrounding Taiwan and its outlying islands Monday.

Marathi actor Atul Parchure dies at 57 after cancer battleRenowned actor Atul Parchure, known for his roles in Marathi and Bollywood cinema, died at the age of 57. He died on 14 October following a relapse of cancer, leaving behind a legacy of memorable performances.

Satellite pics show new Chinese settlement under construction near Pangong LakeSatellite imagery accessed by India Today shows significant Chinese construction activity, 38 km from the 2020 standoff point, raising fresh concerns over border infrastructure.

Opposition MPs walk out of Waqf Bill committee meeting, cite 'personal attacks'Opposition MPs staged a boycott of the parliamentary committee meeting on the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, citing procedural violations and unwarranted personal allegations.

Putin very interested in poison: Russian double agent who survived Novichok attackSergei Skripal, who sold Russian secrets to Britain, believes Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered his and his daughter's Novichok poisoning.

Exclusive: Lawrence Bishnoi reveals who's on his hit-listIndia Today has exclusively accessed details from the NIA questioning, revealing that gangster Lawrence Bishnoi had identified five key targets, including Bollywood actor Salman Khan.
This non-Maruti, Hyundai, Mahindra SUV scores 4-star safety rating, French phenomThe Basalt is the only non-Tata model whose Bharat NCAP safety test result has been announced as of now.

Video: Man shot alongside Baba Siddique writhes in painA video has emerged showing the individual who was shot alongside Baba Siddique. At the time the shots were fired, this person was passing by and was hit in the leg.

Bahraich clashes: Cops seal borders, drones deployed after hospital, shops torchedTension erupted in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich after clashes during a Durga idol immersion procession left a 22-year-old man dead. Heavy police forces were deployed, internet services were suspended, and multiple arrests were made to control the situation.
A Tesla car crashes and catches fire in France, killing 4A Tesla vehicle reportedly hit a road sign and caught fire in France, killing all four people inside.

Love, Money, Fame: SEVENTEEN sings about love in new music video with DJ KhaledK-pop sensation SEVENTEEN has unveiled their much-anticipated 12th mini-album, Spill the Feels. The lead track - Love, Money, Fame - is made in collaboration with Grammy-winning producer DJ Khaled.

Actors Hugh Jackman, Kate Hudson to star in upcoming musical film Song Sung Blue Kate Hudson and Hugh Jackman will headline the new movie musical Song Sung Blue, inspired by a true Neil Diamond tribute band story. Directed by Craig Brewer, the film will explore themes of love and resilience.

Joker: Folie a Deux plummets at US box office, sees 80% dropJoker: Folie a Deux faces a dramatic 80% drop in its second weekend at the North American box office. The comic-book film sequel is overtaken by indie horror hit Terrifier 3 and animated feature The Wild Robot.

Kartik Aaryan, Vidya Balan join Amitabh Bachchan on KBC 16 to promote Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3Actors Kartik Aaryan and Vidya Balan appeared on Kaun Banega Crorepati to promote Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3. The film, directed by Anees Bazmee, is set for a grand Diwali release, clashing with Singham Again.

Reliance Jio lobbies India on satellite spectrum in new face-off with Elon MuskMukesh Ambani's Reliance Jio has argued that the telecom regulator incorrectly concluded that home satellite broadband spectrum should be allocated and not auctioned, a letter seen by Reuters shows, intensifying a face-off with Elon Musk's Starlink.

OpenAI reveals how cybercriminals are asking ChatGPT to write malwareOpenAI's latest report reveals how cybercriminals are exploiting ChatGPT to write malware and conduct cyber-attacks, raising concerns over AI misuse.

Meta chief AI scientist says warnings about AI are complete nonsenseThe man who plays a big role behind the artificial intelligence that we see today has reportedly said that we exaggerate the pros and cons of AI. Yann LeCun, chief AI scientist at Meta says AI doesn't even have the intelligence of our pets, let alone the humans'.

Apple is said to launch four products later this month, here are the detailsAccording to reports, Apple is set to host a major launch event at the end of October. The company is tipped to introduce at least four new products, which are said to be released on November 1. Here are the details.

sports.headline: HIL Franchises spend big to finalise squad on auction Day 2The Hockey India League 2024/25 Player Auction witnessed a bidding frenzy as Indian and overseas stars fetched top prices. Victor Wegnez emerged as the costliest buy, while Indian talent dominated with record-breaking deals across the two-day event.

Will India bank on three-pacer combination for NZ Tests? Coach Gambhir reactsIndia vs New Zealand: India may stick with a three-pacer strategy for the first Test against New Zealand in Bengaluru with grass on the pitch and overcast weather influencing the decision.

Shan Masood, Jason Gillespie's selection powers curtailed by Pakistan's new panelThe Pakistan Cricket Board has restructured its selection process, reducing the authority of captain Shan Masood and head coach Jason Gillespie. This change follows a recent defeat and involves a new selection panel taking charge.

Impact Player rule scrapped for Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy 2024 The BCCI has decided to scrap the contentious Impact Player rule for the upcoming Syed Mushtaq Ali T20 Trophy. The Impact Player concept was introduced in SMAT a couple of years ago.

New Zealand into Women's T20 World Cup semi-final after beating PakistanPakistan's hopes were crushed in a devastating loss to New Zealand in the Women's T20 World Cup, as their abysmal fielding and dismal batting led to their elimination, along with India's, from the tournament.

India crash out in group stage, fail to reach semis after 8 yearsICC Women's T20 World Cup: Team India suffered a heart-breaking group-stage exit from the ongoing ICC tournament after New Zealand defeated Pakistan to storm into the semi-final.

Watch: Fatima Sana in tears after joining Pakistan squad following father's demiseWomen's T20 World Cup: Pakistan captain Fatima Sana was visibly emotional during the national anthem after she rejoined the squad following the recent passing of her father.

Pakistan vs New Zealand, 2nd Test: Desperate Pakistan aim for turnaroundPakistan will aim to reverse their fortunes in the second Test against England after a crushing innings defeat in the opener. In a surprising decision, the PCB dropped senior players, banking on fresh faces and bold tactics.

Aakash Chopra cheekily shuts down troll over Burmah no-ball postFormer India cricketer Aakash Chopra had a witty response to an online troll on X, who attempted to mock him with a picture of Jasprit Bumrah's infamous no-ball from the 2017 Champions Trophy. Chopra clapped back by sharing the viral image of Mohammad Amir's controversial no-ball, leaving fans amused.

Explained: Why Pakistan are playing on same Multan pitch for successive Tests Pakistan vs England, 2nd Test: In a desperate bid for a quick turnaround, Pakistan have resorted to a never-seen-before tactic. Multan will employ a used pitch for the second Test, which effectively means the opening day of the match will be played on a Day 6 pitch at the iconic venue. Pakistan have picked a spin-heavy XI for the encounter, starting October 15.

FIFA to review transfer rules after Lassana Diarra court decisionFIFA is set to re-evaluate its transfer regulations after an EU court deemed certain rules unlawful. The move comes in response to a case involving former France player Lassana Diarra.

India not thinking about Australia: Gambhir ahead of New Zealand TestIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir stressed that the team's sole focus remains on the upcoming Test series against New Zealand, keeping future matches, including the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, off their radar for now.

Shahid Afridi reacts to Pakistan resting Babar, Shaheen and Naseem in England TestsFormer captain Shahid Afridi said he supports the selectors' decision to rest Babar Azam, Shaheen Afridi and Naseem Shah for the last two Tests against England. The decision to leave out the three star cricketers, including their former captain, has divided opinions in Pakistan cricket fraternity.

Rachin explains how Jadeja-Ashwin make India unbeatable at home in TestsNew Zealand all-rounder Rachin Ravindra stated on Monday that neutralising the double danger offered by senior spinners Ravichandran Ashwin and Ravindra Jadeja will be critical to New Zealand's success in the three-match series against India.

Rachin Ravindra banking on past exploits in World Cup, IPL for India Test seriesNew Zealand all-rounder Rachin Ravindra is gearing up for a challenging Test series in India, relying on his past performances in the subcontinent to guide him. Despite no practice matches ahead, the Black Caps are hopeful of leveraging their recent experiences.

Ben Stokes reacts to Babar Azam getting dropped: It is Pakistan's issueEngland captain Ben Stokes dismissed concerns over Babar Azam's omission from Pakistan's squad, focusing solely on his team's preparations for the second Test, while Pakistan faces backlash over dropping three key players.

PAK vs ENG: Debutant Kamran Ghulam replaces Babar Azam for second TestPakistan's playing XI for the second Test against England includes Kamran Ghulam, Noman Ali, and Zahid Mehmood as replacements for Babar Azam, Shaheen Afridi, and Naseem Shah, signalling a spin-heavy strategy in the crucial match.

BCCI announces schedule for India women's ODI series vs New ZealandThe Board of Control for Cricket in India announced the fixtures for India's (Senior Women) upcoming three-match ODI series against New Zealand. The series, to be played at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad, is part of the ICC Women's Championship.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
